poem:
"In the Shadow of Kensington"

As twilight hues fall 
on Kensington's facade,
shock, like an uninvited guest,
walks among whispers in the crowd.
Hands clutching talismans of light,
capturing a pain too fresh to name.
In royal halls, a woman battles,
her plight illuminating common ground,
fusing us in silent solidarity.
We, but humble witnesses,
caught in the soft glow of resilience.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
